title: Pynndescent in t-SNE with k=15 seems a lot slower than in UMAP
body:
I've just noticed that UMAP 0.4.6 with pynndescent 0.5 can be quite a bit faster to construct the kNN graph compared to openTSNE with uniform kernel and k=15. This does not make sense to me. I added verbose=1 to the pynndescent call within openTSNE and here is what I see:

UMAP - 34 sec:

```
UMAP(angular_rp_forest=True, metric='cosine', verbose=1)
Construct fuzzy simplicial set
Mon Oct 19 13:54:22 2020 Finding Nearest Neighbors
Mon Oct 19 13:54:22 2020 Building RP forest with 21 trees
Mon Oct 19 13:54:32 2020 metric NN descent for 17 iterations
	 1  /  17
	 2  /  17
	 3  /  17
	 4  /  17
	 5  /  17
	 6  /  17
	Stopping threshold met -- exiting after 6 iterations
Mon Oct 19 13:54:58 2020 Finished Nearest Neighbor Search
```

tSNE -- 61 sec

```
===> Finding 15 nearest neighbors using NN descent approximate search using cosine distance...
Mon Oct 19 14:03:15 2020 Building RP forest with 21 trees
Mon Oct 19 14:03:33 2020 metric NN descent for 17 iterations
	 1  /  17
	 2  /  17
	 3  /  17
	 4  /  17
	 5  /  17
	 6  /  17
	Stopping threshold met -- exiting after 6 iterations
   --> Time elapsed: 61.53 seconds
```

I ran both snippets twice to make sure all numba code was pre-compiled.

I don't know why this happens. The `pynndescent` call in UMAP looks identical to the one in t-SNE. https://github.com/lmcinnes/umap/blob/master/umap/umap_.py#L290
